channel.title: The problem keeping me from making the permanant switch
channel.description:
Well I want to switch from windows to Ubuntu so damn bad.
The one thing keeping me back is internet. I have my drivers and everything, it finds my network, I try to connect, it says its "attempting to join the network linksys" but then it fails. It always fails.
So i'm helping someone can diagnose this problem and help me fix it.
Any help is appreciated.[br][size=1]Posted on: August 31, 2007, 10:44:36 PM[/size][hr]And as I hit post, IE crashed. :-D

item.title: The problem keeping me from making the permanant switch
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

[quote=“Cruzer, post:1, topic:139137”]Well I want to switch from windows to Ubuntu so damn bad.

The one thing keeping me back is internet. I have my drivers and everything, it finds my network, I try to connect, it says its “attempting to join the network linksys” but then it fails. It always fails.

So i’m helping someone can diagnose this problem and help me fix it.

Any help is appreciated.[br][size=1]Posted on: August 31, 2007, 10:44:36 PM[/size][hr]And as I hit post, IE crashed. :-D[/quote]

If you post the result from ifconfig, iwconfig and maybe netstat -rn then that might help us find out whats wrong… (I don’t exactly know too much about them atm but while trying to get my internet working (took bloody ages) I asked around on ubuntuforums.org and they asked for that a lot and you can tell if it is connecting properly)

Read full topic

@nicatron wrote:

I have the same exact problem, the WUSB54GC wifi adapter and it won’t connect.

If this is your model usb then i think that linksys is gay for not helping anybody with this stuff.
I sent linksys a message and the reply said:

I have no idea what this Linux thing is, care to elaborate?
Talk about bad costomer service!

item.title: The problem keeping me from making the permanant switch
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Cruzer:

And as I hit post, IE crashed.

All the more reason to switch

Anyway, are you trying to join the network with a direct connection or via wireless? If wireless, is it encrypted? Is the wireless adapter internal or external?
